IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE ORGANIZATION IS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION ORGANIZED FOR THE PURPOSE OF PROVIDING HOUSING, SUPERVISION, TRAINING AND THERAPEUTIC, MEDICAL, EDUCATIONAL AND OTHER RELATED SERVICES TO DEVELOPMENTALLY DISABLED INDIVIDUALS IN THE STATE OF FLORIDA. THE ORGANIZATION WAS INCORPORATED EXCLUSIVELY FOR CHARITABLE AND EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES. THE ORGANIZATION ACTS AS HEADQUARTERS TO THE PHINEAS SUBSIDIARIES AND AS CENTRALIZED CASH DISBURSEMENT, CASH RECEIPTS, PAYROLL, CLIENT TRUST, AND MANAGEMENT/ADMINISTRATION SERVICES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE ORGANIZATION IS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION ORGANIZED FOR THE PURPOSE OF PROVIDING HOUSING, SUPERVISION, TRAINING AND THERAPEUTIC, MEDICAL, EDUCATIONAL AND OTHER RELATED SERVICES TO DEVELOPMENTALLY DISABLED INDIVIDUALS IN THE STATE OF FLORIDA. THE ORGANIZATION WAS INCORPORATED EXCLUSIVELY FOR CHARITABLE AND EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES. THE ORGANIZATION ACTS AS HEADQUARTERS TO THE PHINEAS SUBSIDIARIES AND AS CENTRALIZED CASH DISBURSEMENT, CASH RECEIPTS, PAYROLL, CLIENT TRUST, AND MANAGEMENT/ADMINISTRATION SERVICES.
IRS990.Desc: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES RESIDENTIAL AND BASIC TRAINING SKILLS TO DEVELOPMENTALLY DISABLED INDIVIDUALS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES SUPERVISION, TRAINING AND THERAPEUTIC, MEDICAL, EDUCATIONAL AND OTHER RELATED SERVICES TO DEVELOPMENTALLY DISABLED INDIVIDUALS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION IS TRUSTEE FOR CLIENT FUNDS WHICH ARE EXPENDED ON BEHALF OF THE CLIENTS FOR PERSONAL ITEMS. THE AMOUNT OF CLIENT FUNDS HELD AND THE OFFSETTING LIABILITY AT JUNE 30, 2018 AND 2017, AMOUNTED TO APPROXIMATELY $768,800 AND $846,400, RESPECTIVELY. THESE AMOUNTS HAVE NOT BEEN REFLECTED IN FORM 990, PART X.

EFFECTIVE NOVEMBER 1, 2017, ALL CLIENT SERVICES PROVIDED BY UNITED CEREBRAL PALSY OF TALLAHASSEE, INC., A RELATED PARTY WITHIN THE SUNRISE GROUP, WERE TRANSFERRED TO THE ORGANIZATION. THIS CONSOLIDATION OF OPERATIONS WAS DONE TO INCREASE OPERATIONAL EFFICIENCY. AS A RESULT OF THE TRANSFER OF OPERATIONS, AS OF NOVEMBER 1, 2017, THE ORGANIZATION HAD AN INCREASE IN ASSETS OF APPROXIMATELY $29,000, AN INCREASE IN LIABILITIES OF APPROXIMATELY $20,000, AND AN INCREASE IN NET ASSETS OF APPROXIMATELY $9,000.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: F.J. MCMACIN III (CHAIR) AND FRANK J. MCMACKIN IV (DIRECTOR) ARE FATHER AND SON. JOSE E. SOUTO, SR. (DIRECTOR) AND JOSE E. SOUTO, JR.(DIRECTOR) ARE FATHER AND SON.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SOLE MEMBER OF THE ORGANIZATION IS THE PHINEAS CORPORATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S SOLE MEMBER, THE PHINEAS CORPORATION, HAS THE AUTHORITY TO ELECT MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AT A MEETING OF MEMBERS CALLED EXPRESSLY FOR THAT PURPOSE, ANY DIRECTOR OR THE ENTIRE BOARD OF DIRECTORS MAY BE REMOVED, WITH OR WITHOUT CAUSE, BY A VOTE OF A MAJORITY OF THE MEMBERS THEN ENTITLED TO VOTE AT AN ELECTION OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FINANCE COMMITTEE CONDUCTS A COMPREHENSIVE REVIEW OF THE FORM 990 BEFORE IT IS FILED. A COPY OF THE RETURN, AS ULTIMATELY FILED, IS PROVIDED TO EACH VOTING MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS BEFORE IT IS FILED WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY COVERS ALL EMPLOYEES, EXECUTIVES, TRUSTEES AND BOARD MEMBERS. THE PRESIDENT & CEO MONITORS AND ENFORCES COMPLIANCE WITH THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS MUST FULLY DISCLOSE TO THE BOARD CHAIR ANY CONTRACT, BUSINESS ARRANGEMENT, OR DIRECT FINANCIAL INTEREST IN A BUSINESS THAT CONTRACTS OR TRANSACTS BUSINESS WITH THE ORGANIZATION. MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, EMPLOYEES AND COMMITTEE MEMBERS MUST MAKE SUCH DISCLOSURES TO THE PRESIDENT & CEO. THE BOARD CHAIR (IN MATTERS INVOLVING THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS), OR THE PRESIDENT & CEO (IN MATTERS INVOLVING MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, EMPLOYEES, AND COMMITTEE MEMBERS), MAY DECIDE WHETHER TO ALLOW CONTINUING INVOLVEMENT IN THE DISCUSSION AND DECISION PROCESS, AND TO WHAT DEGREE (I.E. DISCUSSION ONLY AND THE MEMBER MUST ABSTAIN FROM VOTING), BEFORE PROCEEDING. THE POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST IS RECORDED IN THE MINUTES OR NOTES OF THE MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION USES A COMPARATIVE PROCESS FOR DETERMINING APPROPRIATE AND JUST COMPENSATION FOR ITS CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER, OTHER OFFICERS, AND KEY EMPLOYEES INCLUSIVE OF A REVIEW AND APPROVAL BY THE ORGANIZATION'S INDEPENDENT BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE PROCESS INCLUDES THE USE OF COMPARABILITY DATA OF SIMILARLY QUALIFIED PERSONS IN FUNCTIONALLY COMPARABLE POSITIONS IN OTHER NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS OF SIMILAR SIZE AND FUNCTION. THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER'S COMPENSATION IS DETERMINED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND THE COMPENSATION OF THE OTHER OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES IS DETERMINED BY THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER. THE COMPENSATION AMOUNT IS REPORTED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR THEIR REVIEW AND APPROVAL. THIS PROCESS INCLUDES CONTEMPORANEOUS DOCUMENTATION AND RECORDKEEPING WITH RESPECT TO THE DELIBERATIONS AND DECISIONS REGARDING THE COMPENSATION ARRANGEMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION UPON REQUEST.

OVERSIGHT OF AUDIT AND SELECTION OF INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT: THE AUDIT COMMITTEE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE SELECTION, MONITORING AND EVALUATION OF AN INDEPENDENT AUDIT FIRM AND OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THERE WAS NO CHANGE IN THIS PROCESS FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.

NET ASSETS TRANSFERRED TO RELATED PARTIES: THE SUNRISE GROUP'S CASH MANAGEMENT POLICIES REQUIRE ALL CASH RECEIPTS TO BE TRANSFERRED TO THE SUNRISE COMMUNITY, INC. GENERAL OPERATING ACCOUNT. CASH TRANSFERS BACK TO THE OTHER MEMBERS OF THE SUNRISE GROUP ARE ONLY MADE TO COVER REQUIRED CASH FLOW NEEDS, CREATING A DUE FROM (TO) OTHER MEMBERS OF THE SUNRISE GROUP. SINCE THERE IS NO INTENTION TO REPAY THESE RELATED-PARTY BALANCES, ANY EXCESS CASH TRANSFERS ARE CONSIDERED A PERMANENT TRANSFER OF NET ASSETS AT YEAR END. DURING THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2018 AND 2017, THE ORGANIZATION HAD NET ASSET TRANSFERS FROM THE OTHER MEMBERS OF THE SUNRISE GROUP AMOUNTING TO $3,832,156 AND $2,260,844, RESPECTIVELY. NET ASSETS TRANSFERRED TO/FROM RELATED PARTIES DURING THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2018 AND 2017, INCLUDED NON-CASH ASSETS AND THEIR RELATED DEBT WITH A NET NON-CASH TRANSFER OF $19,046 AND $369,580,RESPECTIVELY.

MANAGEMENT FEE: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES SUBSTANTIALLY ALL EXECUTIVE MANAGEMENT, FINANCIAL, INFORMATION SYSTEMS AND HUMAN RESOURCE MANAGEMENT FUNCTIONS TO THE OTHER MEMBERS OF THE SUNRISE GROUP. THE ORGANIZATION CHARGED MANAGEMENT FEES OF $4,818,271 AND $4,815,361 FOR THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2018 AND 2017, RESPECTIVELY, FOR SUCH SERVICES. THESE AMOUNTS ARE PRESENTED AS A REDUCTION IN MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSE IN THE STATEMENTS OF ACTIVITIES.
